titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Vassar College Office of the Treasurer Records, 1861-1973 (bulk 1861-1934)

did.head: Collection Summary

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Vassar College. Office of the Treasurer

did.unittitle: Vassar College Office of the Treasurer Records

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: This collection contains materials relating to the financial and business operations of Vassar College, primarily records kept by the Treasurer, Cashier, Accountant, and other administrators involved in college expenses and accounts.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The position of College Treasurer was established in 1861 as an officer of the Vassar College Board of Trustees, with Matthew Vassar, Jr., serving as the first Treasurer from 1861 until his death in 1881. The Treasurer managed most of Vassar College's finances until 1922, when the position of Comptroller (later renamed Controller in 1991) was established. The Comptroller reported to the Treasurer until 1927, when it became its own office, separate from the Treasurer. The position of Cashier was not officially established until 1931, reporting to the Comptroller.

In 1966, the Vice President of Finance and Administration was created to oversee a number of financial roles for the college. The Office of the Comptroller was overseen at various times between 1966 and 1985 by either the Vice President of Finance and Administration or the Office of the Treasurer.

list.item: Willard L. Dean, 1882-1883 (Registrar and Assistant Treasurer)
Willard L. Dean, 1893-1898 Oct (Treasurer and Secretary to the Board of Trustees)
Edward Elsworth, 1898-1903 (Treasurer and Secretary to the Board of Trustees)
George Washington Polk, 1921-1922 (Acting Treasurer; promoted to Comptroller in 1922)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials relating to the financial and business operations of Vassar College, primarily records kept by the Treasurer, Cashier, Accountant, and other administrators involved in college expenses and accounts. Records include financial ledgers and journals, including: cash books; day books; account ledgers for students, offices, departments, and businesses with whom Vassar obtained goods or services; deposit book; expense books; investment books; and other miscellaneous bookkeeping records. Also included are receipts and vouchers of financial transactions, as well as correspondence of the treasurer and other administrators under the purview of the Office of the Treasurer.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: Series I. Financial Record Books, 1861-1973; Series II. Receipts and Vouchers, [1865?] - circa 1902; and Series III. Administrative Files, 1876-1925.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library .

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Most materials in Series II and III are unprocessed.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from various sources, including the Office of the Controller and long-term storage, 2004-2024. (A2004-019, A2008-028, A2017-012, A2024-003, A2024-017)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Vassar College Office of the Treasurer Records, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by item or file title.

did.unittitle: Accounts Journal - General and Students, School Supplies,

p.emph: Organized alphabetically by account, no index.
Sections include: Faculty, faculty charges, faculty laundry, and student laundry.

did.unittitle: Accounts Journal - Students and Faculty, School Supplies,
Accounts Journal - Students and Faculty, School Supplies,
Accounts Journal - Students, Music books and scores,
Accounts Journal - Students, Music, books, and supplies,

p.emph: Handwritten transcripts of wills featuring bequests to Vassar College, 1868-1889. Includes Edward L. Beadle (p. 63), Stephen M. Buckingham (p. 93), Jacob P. Giraud (p. 29), Warren J. Merrill (p. 145), John Guy Vassar (p. 109), Matthew Vassar (p. 3), and Matthew Vassar, Jr. (p. 39).
p. 1-699 Student accounts, p. 700-917 College, faculty, and misc accounts, p. 1299-1360 Surplus accounts, room deposits, p. 1399-1400 deposit account.
Organized alphabetically by fund, with index.

did.unittitle: "Records of articles for safekeeping, and returned,"

p.emph: Ledger of physical objects of value.
"Articles bought for the Steward's Dept" (food, soap, etc.)
Organized by enrollment year, then alphabetically by student.
